## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 284, 314, 299]]<|/det|>
Paper 6 Alternative to Practical  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[675, 265, 861, 280]]<|/det|>
0625/62  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[675, 285, 861, 300]]<|/det|>
October/November 2019

1 hour  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 323, 395, 339]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 343, 348, 358]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 373, 369, 388]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 397, 680, 412]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 412, 306, 426]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 426, 479, 440]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 440, 479, 454]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 453, 364, 467]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 478, 243, 492]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 502, 343, 516]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 516, 730, 531]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 540, 576, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 555, 722, 570]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 68, 89, 85]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 67, 826, 87]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 380, 875, 428]]<|/det|>
The student adjusts the length of the pendulum until the distance \(d\), measured to the centre of the bob, is \(50.0 \text{cm}\). State one precaution that you would take to obtain the length of \(50.0 \text{cm}\) as accurately as possible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 69, 89, 85]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 875, 100]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the time taken for ice cubes in a container to melt using different insulating materials on the container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 113, 400, 129]]<|/det|>
The following apparatus is available:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 144, 299, 158]]<|/det|>
a copper container

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 157, 774, 173]]<|/det|>
a variety of insulating materials that can be wrapped round the copper container

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 172, 275, 186]]<|/det|>
a thermometer

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 186, 260, 201]]<|/det|>
a stopwatch

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 275, 875, 306]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate the time taken for ice cubes to melt using different insulating materials.
